title: 115_hr2185
content: The Act is titled the "Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act" and involves determining if foreign financial institutions have facilitated transactions for covered persons. The President must determine if foreign financial institutions have knowingly facilitated significant transactions for covered persons every 180 days for up to 5 years. Certifications of these determinations must be submitted to congressional committees in unclassified form, with the possibility of a classified annex. For this section, significant transactions and financial services are determined according to section 561.404 of title 31, Code of Federal Regulations. SEC. 3 of the Act requires the President to determine if foreign persons listed in specific attachments have supported certain individuals and report to Congress every 180 days. The determination must be in unclassified form but may include a classified annex. A person described in this section is an organization designated as a foreign terrorist organization by the Secretary of State or a foreign person whose property is blocked under various Executive Orders related to terrorism and weapons of mass destruction proliferation.
